paper_abstract: It is shown that every homogeneous set of n points in d-dimensional Euclidean space determines at least Omega(n(2d/(d2+1))/ log(c(d)) n) distinct distances for a constant c( d) > 0. In three-space the above general bound is slightly improved and it is shown that every homogeneous set of n points determines at least Omega(n(0.6091)) distinct distances.
paper_title: Distinct distances in homogeneous sets in Euclidean space
